page.title: 10Fairfield Hospital St.Helens
page.content: Fairfield was built in 1861 by Samuel Robinson as a private house. It has been a{hospital}since January 1980,the idea of{David Pilkington and Dr. {Higham.}It has an operating theatre and other facilities.It takes 41 patients and out patients.There are 130 people working there, 80 of them are nurses and 50 domestic and office staff.In the grounds there are two other houses. They are Crank House and Rainford Hall.In Crank House there are 16 beds and it is a nursing home. Rainford Hall is used for offices. All the grounds are owned by{Anthony {Pilkington.}The alterations to turn the hall into a hospital took 2 years and cost Â£1,000,000. The operating theatre was built in the garage. The abandoned railway line from Rainford to St.Helens runs through the grounds.
